definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) reared in a specified environment or way.
cause (an animal) to produce offspring, typically in a controlled and organized way.
examples: he wants to see the animals his new stock has been bred from

definitions.definition: (of animals) mate and then produce offspring.
examples: toads are said to return to the pond of their birth to breed
synonyms: propagate; mate "elephants breed readily in captivity"

definitions.definition: develop (a kind of animal or plant) for a particular purpose or quality.
examples: these horses are bred for this sport

definitions.definition: rear and train (someone) to behave in a particular way or have certain qualities.
synonyms: nurture "she was born and bred in the village"

definitions.definition: cause (something) to happen or occur, typically over a period of time.
synonyms: result in; Morestir up; literarybeget "the political system bred discontent"
